title: What are some reasons why I should write fanfiction books? - Quora

response.answer_text: You should not write fanfiction “books” as you can’t publish anything based on another’s work unless the work is in the public domain or you’ve been granted authorization by the author or property owner — and the folks who write those books are usually contracted by the property owners, as in the case of things like the Star Wars extended universe. As for why you should write fan fiction, it’s a great way to improve your writing skills with some basic support in place (existing readers who already enjoy a particular set of characters) and some of the plot or characterization has already been created for you, giving you a “boost.”

If you have to ask why you should write fanfiction books, then you shouldn’t. Save your time, go write something else, go do something else. Fanfiction writers write for the love of it. However, if you can write Star Trek or Star War novels, or novelization of movies and television shows under contract, there may be a paycheck in it for you.
